revised_title: Investigation of Molecular Surface-Energy in Esters and Its Relation to Chemical Constitution
tldr: The authors investigate the molecular surface-energy of esters and its variation with chemical constitution. They find that the acid radical determines the value of surface-energy and that molecular volumes do not admit of regular comparison at temperatures with equal surface-energy. The study also reveals that boiling points at corresponding pressures do not bear a constant ratio to temperatures of equal molecular surface-energy.
